required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Phase II Study of Gemcitabine Plus Cisplatin as First-Line Therapy in Patients With Epithelial Ovarian Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The primary endpoint of this study is to assess the objective tumor response rate in patients with advanced epithelial ovarian cancer receiving combination of Gemcitabine at a dose 1250 mg/m2 (Day 1 and 8) with Cisplatin 75 mg/m2 (Day 1) as first-line treatment

primary_outcome.time_frame: every other 21 day cycle (6-8 cycles), every 3 months during long-term follow-up

secondary_outcome.time_frame: every other 21 day cycle (6-8 cycles) and every 3 months during long-term follow-up
every other 21 day cycle (6-8 cycles) and every 3 months during long-term follow-up
every other 21 day cycle (6-8 cycles) and every 3 months during long-term follow-up

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Maximum Common Toxicity Criteria - National Cancer Institute (CTC-NCI): Possibly Related to Study Drug by Grade
secondary_outcome.time_frame: every 21 day cycle (6-8 cycles) and every 3 months during long-term follow-up

intervention.description: 1250 mg/m2, intravenous (IV) day 1 and day 8, every 21 days x 6 cycles or disease progression or unacceptable toxicity
75 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles or disease progression or unacceptable toxicity

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ECOG = 0-2
- Operated patients
- disease stage III-IV
Exclusion Criteria:
- No prior chemotherapy or radiation therapy

group.title: Gemcitabine + Cisplatin
group.description: Gemcitabine: 1250 mg/m2, intravenous (IV) day 1 and day 8, every 21 days x 6 cycles or disease progression or unacceptable toxicity. Cisplatin: 75 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles or disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

group.title: Gemcitabine + Cisplatin
group.description: Gemcitabine: 1250 mg/m2, intravenous (IV) day 1 and day 8, every 21 days x 6 cycles or disease progression or unacceptable toxicity. Cisplatin: 75 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles or disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

class.title: Stage I - Tumor Limited to Ovaries
Stage II - Pelvic Extension and/or Implants
Stage IIIc - Peritoneal Metastasis More Than 2 cm

measure.title: Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Performance Status Score

class.title: 3 - Partially Confined to Bed, Limited Self Care

measure.title: State of Patient Relative to Menopause
Time from Initial Diagnosis to Study Entry

outcome.title: Best Overall Tumor Response
outcome.description: Best response recorded from the start of treatment until disease progression/recurrence (taking as reference for progressive disease the smallest measurements recorded since the treatment started).
outcome.time_frame: every other 21 day cycle (6-8 cycles), every 3 months during long-term follow-up

group.title: Gemcitabine + Cisplatin
group.description: Gemcitabine: 1250 mg/m2, intravenous (IV) day 1 and day 8, every 21 days x 6 cycles or disease progression or unacceptable toxicity. Cisplatin: 75 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles or disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

measure.title: Best Overall Tumor Response
measure.description: Best response recorded from the start of treatment until disease progression/recurrence (taking as reference for progressive disease the smallest measurements recorded since the treatment started).

outcome.title: Duration of Response
outcome.description: The duration of a complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) was defined as the time from first objective status assessment of CR or PR to the first time of progression or death as a result of any cause.
outcome.time_frame: every other 21 day cycle (6-8 cycles) and every 3 months during long-term follow-up

group.title: Gemcitabine + Cisplatin
group.description: Gemcitabine: 1250 mg/m2, intravenous (IV) day 1 and day 8, every 21 days x 6 cycles or disease progression or unacceptable toxicity. Cisplatin: 75 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles or disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

measure.title: Duration of Response
measure.description: The duration of a complete response (CR) or partial response (PR) was defined as the time from first objective status assessment of CR or PR to the first time of progression or death as a result of any cause.

outcome.title: Time to Progressive Disease
outcome.description: Defined as the time from study enrollment to the first date of disease progression. Time to disease progression was censored at the date of death if death was due to other cause.
outcome.time_frame: every other 21 day cycle (6-8 cycles) and every 3 months during long-term follow-up

group.title: Gemcitabine + Cisplatin
group.description: Gemcitabine: 1250 mg/m2, intravenous (IV) day 1 and day 8, every 21 days x 6 cycles or disease progression or unacceptable toxicity. Cisplatin: 75 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles or disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

measure.title: Time to Progressive Disease
measure.description: Defined as the time from study enrollment to the first date of disease progression. Time to disease progression was censored at the date of death if death was due to other cause.

outcome.title: Time to Treatment Failure
outcome.description: Defined as the time from study enrollment to the first observation of disease progression, death as a result of any cause, or early discontinuation of treatment. Time to treatment failure was censored at the date of the last follow-up visit for patients who did not discontinue early, who were still alive, and who have not progressed.
outcome.time_frame: every other 21 day cycle (6-8 cycles) and every 3 months during long-term follow-up

group.title: Gemcitabine + Cisplatin
group.description: Gemcitabine: 1250 mg/m2, intravenous (IV) day 1 and day 8, every 21 days x 6 cycles or disease progression or unacceptable toxicity. Cisplatin: 75 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles or disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

measure.title: Time to Treatment Failure
measure.description: Defined as the time from study enrollment to the first observation of disease progression, death as a result of any cause, or early discontinuation of treatment. Time to treatment failure was censored at the date of the last follow-up visit for patients who did not discontinue early, who were still alive, and who have not progressed.

outcome.title: Number of Patients With Maximum Common Toxicity Criteria - National Cancer Institute (CTC-NCI): Possibly Related to Study Drug by Grade
outcome.description: Grades range from 0 (no toxicity) to 4 (life-threatening or disabling).
outcome.time_frame: every 21 day cycle (6-8 cycles) and every 3 months during long-term follow-up

group.title: Gemcitabine + Cisplatin
group.description: Gemcitabine: 1250 mg/m2, intravenous (IV) day 1 and day 8, every 21 days x 6 cycles or disease progression or unacceptable toxicity. Cisplatin: 75 mg/m2, intravenous (IV), every 21 days x 6 cycles or disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.

measure.title: Number of Patients With Maximum Common Toxicity Criteria - National Cancer Institute (CTC-NCI): Possibly Related to Study Drug by Grade
measure.description: Grades range from 0 (no toxicity) to 4 (life-threatening or disabling).

class.title: Patients with at least one CTC - Grade 1
Patients with at least one CTC - Grade 2
Patients with at least one CTC - Grade 3
Patients with at least one CTC - Grade 4

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
